# setFrame(_:for:completionHandler:)

**Instance Method**

Called to set the frame of the window.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor optional func setFrame(_ frame: CGRect, for context: WKWebExtensionContext, completionHandler: @escaping ((any Error)?) -> Void)
```

```swift
@MainActor optional func setFrame(_ frame: CGRect, for context: WKWebExtensionContext) async throws
```

## Parameters

- **frame**: The new frame of the window, in screen coordinates.
- **context**: The context in which the web extension is running.
- **completionHandler**: A block that must be called upon completion. It takes a single error argument, which should be provided if any errors occurred.

## Discussion

On macOS, the implementation of both [doc://com.apple.webkit/documentation/WebKit/WKWebExtensionWindow/frame(for:)] and [doc://com.apple.webkit/documentation/WebKit/WKWebExtensionWindow/screenFrame(for:)] are prerequisites. On iOS, iPadOS, and visionOS, only [doc://com.apple.webkit/documentation/WebKit/WKWebExtensionWindow/frame(for:)] is a prerequisite. Without the respective method(s), this method will not be called.

## Related Documentation

- **frame(for:)**: Called when the frame of the window is needed.
- **screenFrame(for:)**: Called when the screen frame containing the window is needed.
